job_title: GBSD OC2 Principal Cyber Software Engineer (Agile Dev/Sec/Ops)
job_description:
Start your future with a new mission: Northrop Grumman Space Systems (NGSP). As a part of the NGSP Team, you will work with experts that develop systems and solutions to keep our world safe. Together we protect our troops, public safety, information, and our planet. It's unique work. It's challenging and rewarding. But most of all, it is work that makes a difference. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work, and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. Join us and launch your career.


Northrop Grumman Space Systems is seeking a Cyber DevSecOps Principal Software Engineer. This position will be located in Huntsville, AL and will support the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent (GBSD) program. Learn more about the GBSD program here .


Northrop Grumman supports the Air Force's sustainment, development, production and deployment of hardware and system modifications for Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) Ground and Airborne Launch Control Systems, Launch Facilities and associated infrastructure.


What you will get to do, specific duties to include, but are not limited to the following:


Designs, develops and tests Cyber functionality

Designs, develops and tests simulation software for use in high fidelity simulation based training systems; training systems may include a combination of console and weapon system simulations, virtual reality, and augmented reality

Design and develop artificial intelligence algorithms to tutor, assess and evaluate learner knowledge

Develops and maintains databases to monitor and analyze learner and system performance

Collaborates with Systems and Quality Engineers to ensure software requirements are met

Performs software peer reviews, version control, automated tests, software analysis, continuous integration, and continuous delivery in accordance with DevSecOps processes and best practices

Performs code quality management and corrects defects

Coordinates with HW/SW team to perform retests and regression tests once defects are corrected.




As a full-time employee of Northrop Grumman Space Systems, you are eligible for our robust benefits package including:


Medical, Dental & Vision coverage

401k

Educational Assistance

Life Insurance

Employee Assistance Programs & Work/Life Solutions

Paid Time Off

Health & Wellness Resources

Employee Discounts



This position's standard work schedule is a 9/80. The 9/80 schedule allows employees who work a nine-hour day Monday through Thursday to take every other Friday off.


GBSD_Jobs


Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and 5 years of relevant experience; or 3 Years with Masters; 0 Years with PhD

Must have an Active DoD Secret Clearance with adjudication in the last 6 years

Candidate should have:


Strong experience with build automation tools such as Jenkins, GoCD, Travis CI or Circle CI

Strong experience with deployment automation tools such as chef, puppet or ansible

Experience with working in a fast pace, agile environment with the ability to work on cross-function Scrum team focused on quality and capability delivery

Experience with Java/C/C++ development and/or front-end web development including JavaScript Frameworks (Angular JS or React), HTML, and CSS

Familiarity with DevSecOps, continuous integration, and continuous delivery

Familiarity with distributed version control software (Git, Mercurial)

Experience with Linux and Windows operating systems

Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, Extreme Programming), Scaled Agile Framework - SAFe for Lean Enterprises





Travel 10-15%


Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

job_description:
Being a Cloud Services Manager at iManage means…
You are responsible for the day to day iManage Cloud Customer Portfolio deployment planning, management including overall Cloud customer satisfaction and reference-ability. You will be accountable for Cloud customer account administration, support, and direction while ensuring day-to-day operational success. In addition, you will interface directly with and provide guidance to our Cloud customer's implementation services provider (iManage Partners), including key stakeholders such as the project manager, business sponsor, networking, and operations teams to ensure iManage Cloud onboarding success.
As a Cloud Services Manager, you will work closely with the internal iManage team such as Cloud Operations and Cloud Support to ensure continuity when a customer transitions from implementation to ongoing operations in the iManage Cloud.
iM Responsible For...
Providing day to day management of assigned cloud onboarding portfolio for project tasks and communications
Proactively managing the relationship with internal and outsourced iManage Cloud implementation partners and customers, including setting expectations regarding deliverables and schedules; ensuring that the project team members are effectively communicating and collaborating
Establishing and maintaining a business relationship with the iManage Cloud customer as well as the customer's implementation team to ensure customer satisfaction with the implementation; serving as the first line of response for customer escalations during implementation
Interfacing with internal iManage teams to ensure successful delivery of the components required for an iManage Cloud implementation including iManage CloudOpS, Networking, R&D, Pre-Sales, Sales, and Product Management.
Maintaining cloud-related customer data in appropriate systems including: Salesforce, DevOps, ZenDesk, etc.
Listening to customer and partner feedback and resolving any issues or conflicts
Assisting with developing relationships with onboarding customers/partners that promote retention and loyalty
Ensuring that new customers are referenceable 60 days after go-live for new deployments and upgrades
Learning and supporting iManage Cloud Product lines for customer onboarding
Educating iManage cloud implementation partners for cloud onboarding processes
Remaining current on technology and process changes as it relates to Cloud Services and Onboarding
Supporting department initiatives which include but not limited to projects such as documentation updates, reporting metrics, and net promoter scores
iM Qualified Because I have...
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Administration, Information Management, Computer Science or the equivalent
A minimum of 3-5+ Years' experience managing software implementation projects
Project Management skills
SaaS/PaaS implementation experience
Excellent business communication, organizational and project management skills
Strong computer skills
Excellent time management and decision-making skills
Bonus Points Because I have...
A working knowledge of iManage products
Used SalesForce and ticketing systems
A team player attitude; an ability to work well independently and as part of a team
A PMP certification
About iManage
iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.
So we're looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when they're solving problems and collaborating with the industry's best and brightest. In exchange, we'll make sure the work you do here is worth doing. That's the iManage way. It's how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees' strengths and unlock their potential. It's how we find meaning in everything we do.
Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

Learn more at: www.imanage.com
Please see our privacy statement for more information on how we handle your personal data: https://imanage.com/privacy-policy/
lsZK1fE7DW

Strong computer skills.  Excellent time management and decision-making skills

job_description:
Company Description

ULC Robotics is a dynamic company growing at a fast pace. We are a leader in product development and engineering services for the natural gas, energy, industrial, and electric markets. We are committed to solving operations and maintenance problems while protecting the environment, reducing costs, increasing efficiency, and improving safety.
We re a global company of thinkers, problem solvers, designers and makers. We each play a unique role. Built on a legacy of innovation, ULC robotics is committed to leading the utility robotics revolution and has been since our start in 2001. We foster an environment which encourages the exchange of ideas and inspires change by challenging traditional thought and approaches to problem-solving. Though we are constantly evolving to meet the complex demands of our industry, we remain dedicated to creating an impact, locally and globally, through meaningful work. We are proud of how our technology helps utilities minimize their impact on the environment and the public while lowering operating costs.

We develop new technologies today, so we can change tomorrow.
Join ULC and be at the forefront of change!

If you have a passion to protect our environment, improve safety, and increase operational efficiencies and seek new challenges, this is the job for you.

Ideally, we are looking for someone with an engineering background in electrical and mechanical engineering with experience designing and integrating complex systems You are best suited for this role if you enjoy both technical and managerial roles and are passionate about developing technology to solve problems. You are an engineer with a strong technical background seeking to take your career to the next level or an experienced project manager with a varied set of backgrounds and experiences. Someone who is detail-oriented with a knack for solving problems and not shy to interact with clients is ideal. You can manage a constantly changing, varied task load with minimal supervision. A team-oriented and proactive attitude is essential
What does a day in the life of a Project Manager look like for ULC Robotics?
You will collaborate with engineering teams to solve technical challenges for our clients. Review project performance for completion on time, budget and to the highest level of quality. A prospective candidate will coordinate developing customer requirements, test plans, and procedures and generate project reports, proposals and presentations. You would be integral in reviewing new opportunities and helping the team to plan and acquire new projects.
To be successful, you will have the following:

Bachelor s degree in appropriate Engineering disciple (Electrical, Mechanical, Robotics) required
3+ years of overall engineering experience required
Direct experience working with an engineering group with a strong engineering background in high-tech fields
Experience in more than one area of product development: prototyping, design, fabrication, integration, and testing
Exemplary verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to travel domestically and internationally if required
Authorization to work in the United States- may consider sponsorship


Having any of the following is a plus:

A Master s or Ph.D. degree in engineering
Prior work on U.S. government projects
Innovative and creative mindset and a background depicting excellence in innovation – examples would be patents, publications, and cool personal projects
Entrepreneurial instincts
Knowledge and/or experience in one or more of the following areas: Control Systems, Artificial Intelligence, Sensors, Robotics
Experience writing proposals

Benefits

Our team is motivated, dedicated and thrives on developing industry-leading products and services that can transform the way our clients work. We foster a unique work environment that inspires employees to express their ideas and work collaboratively towards finding innovative solutions to problems. We attract top talent by offering some of the best benefits in the industry. Some of the benefits we offer our team are listed below:

Medical Insurance
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
401(k)
4 weeks of PTO on an annual basis (prorated on date of hire)
Aflac Insurance programs including

EOE/disability/veteran

job_description:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field,8+ years experience building successful production software systems,6+ years management experience (including a combination of experience hiring, managing performance, and providing technical leadership),3+ years building systems that build and leverage AI-based technologies.

Want to disrupt an industry by delighting customers? Looking for a job where your work can have direct and massive impact? Excited to join one of the newest and most exciting AWS services? Come be a leader on a team that is building a product that will touch millions of people daily.

We are just getting started building the most advanced call center system in existence!

Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of the ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.
We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex engineering and algorithmic problems.

Amazon Connect Team is looking for a passionate and talented Senior Manager responsible for a new, unannounced set of features. The position represents a rare opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing business soon after launch, and help shape the technology and product as we grow. You will be playing a crucial role in developing the next generation contact center, and get the opportunity to design and deliver scaleable, resilient systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.

To succeed in this position, you'll establish teams that work with customers as well as tech leaders within the team and across AWS. You'll drive operational improvements across internal and external organizations, while building new systems that leverage AI in the call center environment. You'll drive a culture that values operational excellence, security, customer focus, and continuous improvement.

Learn more about Amazon Connect here:
https://aws.amazon.com/connect/

Media coverage on Amazon Connect:
https://techcrunch.com/2017/03/28/aws-amazon-connect/
Power of Amazon Connect:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9qky_E39-_I

job_title: GBSD LGC Sr Principal Software Engineer (Agile Dev/Sec/Ops)
job_description:
Start your future with a new mission: Northrop Grumman Space Systems (NGSP). As a part of the NGSP Team, you will work with experts that develop systems and solutions to keep our world safe. Together we protect our troops, public safety, information, and our planet. It's unique work. It's challenging and rewarding. But most of all, it is work that makes a difference. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work, and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. Join us and launch your career.


Northrop Grumman Space Systems is seeking a Sr Principal DevSecOps Software Engineer. This position will be located in Bellevue, NE and will support the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent (GBSD) program. Learn more about the GBSD program here .


Northrop Grumman supports the Air Force's sustainment, development, production and deployment of hardware and system modifications for Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) Ground and Airborne Launch Control Systems, Launch Facilities and associated infrastructure.


What you will get to do, specific duties to include, but are not limited to the following:


Designs, develops and tests displays, controls and functionality

Designs, develops and tests simulation software for use in high fidelity simulation based training systems; training systems may include a combination of console and weapon system simulations, virtual reality, and augmented reality

Design and develop artificial intelligence algorithms to tutor, assess and evaluate learner knowledge

Develops and maintains databases to monitor and analyze learner and system performance

Collaborates with Systems and Quality Engineers to ensure software requirements are met

Performs software peer reviews, version control, automated tests, software analysis, continuous integration, and continuous delivery in accordance with DevSecOps processes and best practices

Performs code quality management and corrects defects

Coordinates with HW/SW team to perform retests and regression tests once defects are corrected



As a full-time employee of Northrop Grumman Space Systems, you are eligible for our robust benefits package including:


Medical, Dental & Vision coverage

401k

Educational Assistance

Life Insurance

Employee Assistance Programs & Work/Life Solutions

Paid Time Off

Health & Wellness Resources

Employee Discounts



This position's standard work schedule is a 9/80. The 9/80 schedule allows employees who work a nine-hour day Monday through Thursday to take every other Friday off.


GBSD_Jobs


Qualifications:

Candidate should have:


Strong experience with build automation tools such as Jenkins, GoCD, Travis CI or Circle CI

Strong experience with deployment automation tools such as chef, puppet or ansible

Experience with working in a fast pace, agile environment with the ability to work on cross-function Scrum team focused on quality and capability delivery

Experience with Java/C/C++ development and/or front-end web development including JavaScript Frameworks (Angular JS or React), HTML, and CSS

Familiarity with DevSecOps, continuous integration, and continuous delivery

Familiarity with distributed version control software (Git, Mercurial)

Experience with Linux and Windows operating systems

Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, Extreme Programming), Scaled Agile Framework - SAFe for Lean Enterprises Basic Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree and 9 years of relevant experience; or 7 Years with Masters; or 4 Years with PhD.

Must have an Active DoD Secret Clearance




Preferred Qualifications:


DoD Secret Clearance has been issued in the last 5 years



Travel 10-15%


Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

job_description:
NVIDIA is seeking a Robotics Software Engineering Manager to own and lead the development and engineering activities directly related to productizing our robotics platform - Isaac.
For two decades, NVIDIA has pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With our invention of the GPU we also set the stage for advances in the field of medical research, computer vision and artificial intelligence. Today NVIDIA is at the groundbreaking level to innovate robotics and intelligent autonomous machines. There has never been a more exciting time to join our company and team.
The team around Project Isaac is building a robotics platform for developing the next generation of intelligent and autonomous robots. Isaac is binding together high-fidelity visual and physical simulation, a high-quality developing platform, hundreds of optimized algorithms to solve hard problems in computer vision and artificial intelligence, and a small and powerful computational platform to form the brain of intelligent machines. Our team consists of experts from all over the world and dozens different fields, and together we want to change the way robots are programmed.
What you’ll be doing:
Lead and grow the ISAAC Apps team. Build a collaborative, and inclusive team
Maintain and improve ISAAC apps ranging from autonomous navigation to collaborative manipulation
Collaborate with the Program Management team to and other teams across the company to set engineering roadmap
Identify and productize technologies developed across the companies
Mentor and guide the professional and technical development of the team members
Participate in code reviews and guide technical discussions.
What we need to see:
Minimum requirement of BS or MS, 8+ years related experience and 4+ years of management/leadership experience, or an equivalent combination of graduate studies and experience
Experience in leading a product focus engineering team
Experience taking projects from Research to Productization
You are comfortable working cross functionally with other teams and groups
You have excellent interpersonal skills
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Exposure to robotics or similar autonomous machine development
Project management tools (e.g. JIRA, Microsoft Project)
NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people on the planet working for us. If you're creative, autonomous, and passionate about autonomous machines - we would love to hear from you!
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
What we're looking for: We are seeking a talented individual responsible for assisting the Director: Informatics in all aspects of managing committee activities, administering projects and managing the department.
This job might be for you if you're interested in:
A welcoming environment that gives you an opportunity to impact patient care and help save lives
Excellent work-life balance through flexible time off and workplace flexibility
Continued professional growth through support of online training, tuition reimbursement, and conferences
A competitive compensation package that includes generous retirement and health benefits
What you'll do:
Support Director and Senior Manager in daily operations of the Informatics Department, including organizing and participating in department operational meetings to review plans and current activities and assess progress toward project goals and deadlines.
Work with Director, Senior Manager, other RSNA staff and volunteers to plan and execute designated special projects in imaging artificial intelligence (AI).
Support Senior Manager as needed in soliciting and reviewing proposals for special informatics demonstrations at the Annual Meeting, including correspondence, travel and logistics planning.
Support Director and Senior Manager in drafting annual budget for the Informatics Department and all informatics-related functions.
Assist the Director of Informatics and Senior Manager in governance, strategic planning and business management.
Administer IHE International membership program, including invoicing, payment, membership questions, reports for the Board and daily correspondence.
Assist the Senior Manager in organizing and conducting special informatics exhibits at the RSNA Annual Meeting.
What you'll need:
BS/BA or equivalent
Two years or more of direct project or event planning experience
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent ability to collaborate with staff and volunteers
Self-directed with personal initiative and good judgment
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Detail oriented with excellent organizational skills
Experience in staff supervision
Problem solving ability and project management skills

job_description:
Position: Administrative Assistant/ Finance
Location: Eden Prairie, MN

Description
Compute North is seeking a Finance/Administrative Assistant with 2-5 years of experience to join our Finance team to help support our growth! We are looking for someone who is independent, highly detailed with proven accuracy when dealing with confidential and financial information.
Responsibilities
Financial Duties (60%)
Manage the entry and coding of invoices, check requests, and payments to ensure proper entry into the financial system.
Handle all customer and vendor correspondence related to financial matters via phone or email.
Correspond with customers and vendors to ensure updated payment information is on file and processed correctly.
Investigate and resolve problems associated with processing of invoices.
Collect and verify invoices, bills, and checks by performing pre-audits to ensure both accuracy and appropriateness prior to payment.
Reconciles various accounts in Netsuite by identifying errors in posting or omissions by applying appropriate accounting standards.
Oversee all financial documentation by maintaining files in an organized fashion for easy reference.

Administrative Duties (40%)
Assist with maintenance, tracking and collection of confidential information for the President and CEO.
Preparing documents, presentations and other materials for executive level meetings and correspondence.
Maintain high level of confidentiality and professionalism; handle assignments that may be confidential in nature and use discretion on determining who has access to such information.
Perform general administrative duties (printing, copying, collating, filing, sorting, etc), as needed.
Assist with other internal projects, as assigned.

Qualifications
2+ years Executive Admin Experience
2+ years of professional level financial experience including AP and AR a plus but not required
Proficient in Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
NetSuite experience a plus, but not required
Proven ability to clearly communicate with all levels of the organization, including C-suite
Ability to be productive in a fast-paced environment with dynamic workdays and changing prioritize
Demonstrated attention to detail, thoroughness, and ability to staying organized while dealing with highly confidential information
Independent, self-starter that can work collaboratively within a team
About Compute North
Compute North delivers high-performance blockchain, cryptocurrency mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and infrastructure solutions to customers around the globe. Led by an experienced management team with deep experience in technology, finance, and energy, the company has been on an extremely fast growth track. With build-out and operational costs at a fraction of a typical data center, Compute North is able to economically scale high-performance computing applications like blockchain and artificial intelligence. Today the company has operations in Minnesota, Texas, South Dakota, and Nebraska.

job_description:
We are looking for a senior product manager to define and own the product vision and roadmap for our artificial intelligence and machine learning product team, offering products that exploit and extract insights on critical customer data. As a senior product manager at Rebellion, you will be responsible for a key part of a rapidly growing portfolio of products, working to rally Rebellion design and engineering teams to deliver on the vision you’ve charted. You will work with Rebellion’s customers and prospective customers, senior DoD/intelligence community and MoD civilian and military leadership to understand the core customer needs and bring a product to market.

This position is located in Washington, D.C., and involves some travel. Relocation packages are available for candidates and their families. Ability to hold a Top Secret security clearance (without polygraph) is preferred, but not required.
We look for a track record of the following:
Delivering software-as-a-service products that scale to large enterprises or consumer bases
Working with software engineers with diverse expertise to deliver a superior product to an end user
Balancing customer needs with engineering constraints
Thorough understanding of product management, engineering, design, and sales functions of the business
Defining and exceeding success metrics with the products you build
Inspirational leadership — the ability to coalesce many groups of stakeholders around a common goal without direct authority
Working with users and shipping products in highly regulated industries or otherwise constrained environments (e.g., government, healthcare, national security, industrial systems design)
Managing senior customer stakeholders with decades of experience in their field
Communicating effectively across diverse technical and non-technical audiences, internally and externally
Establishing clear product-market fit, understanding the core customer need, and breaking this into priorities for design and engineering teams
Experience bringing artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision products to market (preferred)
At least 8 years of experience in product management or product design
You might be a good fit if you:
have a passion for getting to know the user and protecting the United States, UK, and its allies from adversaries
are self-directed and can prioritize experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer
are capable of rapid iteration and comfortable with ambiguity in initial problem definition
Your work will matter because:

As a senior product manager in the artificial intelligence/machine learning portfolio, your work will drive our strategic product and technology vision for products running scaled ML models for media exploitation (imagery, full-motion video, text). You will own the team's products, existing or new, from ideation through development to launch, growth, and expansion.

Rebellion is a well-capitalized technology start-up seeking a talented senior product manager who is passionate about defining and delivering modern, life-changing software products to the US Department of Defense (DoD), the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), and their allies. Expect talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers. Compensation includes full medical coverage and meaningful equity ownership.

job_title: Senior Technical Program Manager, Machine Learning
job_description:
Rebellion is a well-capitalized technology start-up seeking a talented senior technical program manager who is passionate about defining and delivering modern, life-changing software products to the US Department of Defense, the UK Ministry of Defence, and their allies. Expect talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers. Compensation includes full medical coverage and meaningful equity ownership.

We are looking for a technical program manager to lead the robust product engineering and design efforts for our artificial intelligence and machine learning team, offering products to exploit and extract insights on critical customer data. As a technical program manager at Rebellion, you will be responsible for executing the vision for a key part of a rapidly growing portfolio of products, working to rally Rebellion design and engineering teams around a common goal.

This position is located in Washington, D.C., and involves some travel. Relocation packages are available for candidates and their families. Ability to hold a Top Secret security clearance (without polygraph) is preferred, but not required.
We look for a track record of the following:
Delivering products using the appropriate agile product management methodology, learning & iterating frequently
Managing day-to-day technical and design direction
Scoping engineering work to generate immediate customer value and maximizing long-term reuse potential
Working with software engineers with diverse expertise to deliver a superior product to an end user
Balancing customer needs with engineering constraints
Thorough understanding of product management, engineering, design, and sales functions of the business
Organizing teams to exceed success metrics with the products you build
Inspirational leadership — the ability to coalesce many groups of stakeholders around a common goal without direct authority
Shipping products in highly regulated industries or otherwise constrained environments (e.g., government, healthcare, national security, industrial systems design)
Capable of rapid iteration and comfort with ambiguity in initial problem definition
Deeply understanding user needs; and drafting, prioritizing, and accepting user stories for each iteration
Strong engineering leadership in the fields of artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision
At least 5-7 years of experience in product or project management
You might be a good fit if you:
have a passion for getting to know the user and protecting the United States, UK, and its allies from adversaries
are self-directed and can prioritize experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer
Your work will matter because:

As a technical program manager in the artificial intelligence/machine learning portfolio, your work will ensure top-quality engineering and design execution for a critical series of products. You will drive production of the team's products, existing or new, from ideation through development to launch, growth, and expansion.

job_description:
Company Description

Signal Vine is the leading Artificial Intelligence (AI)-powered messaging platform transforming how higher education leaders reach, support, and engage students. We believe in the power of conversation to build communities and to strengthen the opportunity for all to succeed. We are passionate about solving education and social challenges through technology-based innovation and building a business we can all be proud of while doing it.
Part of the growing education technology presence in Alexandria, VA, Signal Vine is located just down the road from Amazon HQ2. We’ve been recognized as one of DC’s most enviable offices by DC Inno and we offer a rewarding culture that promotes teamwork, growth, and enjoying our day to day roles. Our high growth business provides employees with a great opportunity to grow in their careers.
Come join us as we build an exciting company that sits at the intersection of education and cutting-edge, AI-backed technology

Job Description

As an Implementation Manager, you will be responsible for controlling software implementation projects and guiding customers through their initial onboarding project. The perfect candidate is interested in executing projects with the customer success in mind. You will act as a consultant and project manager working with customers to initially set up the Signal Vine platform.
A successful Implementation Manager will maintain a high-level of customer satisfaction and act as the day-to-day face of the organization. You'll be the voice of your customers internally, suggest ways to improve their user experience and help knock down barriers to their success. This position reports to the Director of Implementation working closely with the Account Management and Customer Success team. It is a full-time position based in Alexandria, VA.
In this role, you will...
Lead project to implement the Signal Vine's messaging platform, from initial kickoff to sending their first messages
Train users on how to use the platform
Ensure customers have a wonderful experience implementing Signal Vine and become raving fans for the platform.
Perform other customer success or support tasks as required

Qualifications

Obsessive about getting all the details right
Internal drive to meet deadlines and to bring others along with you
Experience working with technology products and platforms
Effective time management and organizational skills
Excellent analytical, verbal and written communication skills
Integrity, high character and ability to maintain the confidentiality of customer data
Interest in technical topics or learning to code is a plus
Desire to work in an early stage company with "can do" start-up attitude
Bachelor's degree (BS/BA) from an accredited, four-year institution (or relevant work experience)
Additional Information

Competitive salary
Medical (employer paid), dental, and vision insurance plans
401(k) plan with company match
Liberal paid time-off
Generous holiday schedule with additional floating holidays
Casual office attire and pet-friendly office
Weekly company-paid lunch
Work In a fun, competitive and collaborative culture

Excellent analytical, verbal and written communication skills.  Bachelor's degree (BS/BA) from an accredited, four-year institution (or relevant work experience)

Description:
Join the Information Technology team at New York’s #1-ranked hospital.
Project Leader – IT Transformation
This is your opportunity to provide world class technology solutions that will directly impact the quality of a patient’s life. At New York Presbyterian Hospital Information Technology is at the forefront of our patient experience. Our mission is to transform the patient experience, hospital operations, and clinical outcomes for the enterprise through healthcare process and technology innovation. This role will be responsible for development and implementation of artificial intelligence, machine learning, robotics, digital robotic process automation, and process improvement & redesign across range of areas such as Finance, IT, Operations, Marketing, Patient Access, Supply Chain and Clinical Care that accelerates our mission.
As a Project Leader for Transformation, you will provide technical and project management services in the design, implementation and maintenance of information technology systems to support NYP’s clinical, administrative and financial operations across all hospital campuses. This position manages Transformation related projects with a focus on Project Planning, Communication, Risk Assessment and Product Development lifecycles.

job_description:
About Saama Technologies
Saama’s Life Science Analytics Cloud (LSAC) provides a suite of cloud applications and consulting services that dramatically improve the clinical trial process using the power of data, analytics, and advanced machine learning/artificial intelligence capabilities. Our solutions deliver actionable risk and performance insights across studies, systems, sites, and vendors. By using elements of our Clinical Intelligence Platform to unify, monitor, and analyze data across all sources, sponsors and CROs alike are able to reduce risk, identify issues in trial data faster, achieve milestones on time, and stay within budget. As a trusted partner, Saama helps speed the time to quality results.

About the Position

The primary function of this role is to be the technical lead of the project implementation, define technical requirements to address the customer's business needs, and drive the data mapping and analytics solution design.

WHAT WE LIKE ABOUT YOU

You enjoy working with data and data models. Integrating it, transforming it, visualizing it, and understanding it.You have amazing problem solving, organizational, and time management skills; along with the ability to work independently, within the team, and cross-functionally while paying close attention to detailYou are comfortable engaging in business and technical conversations in a Clinical Operations setting and can make recommendations to solve business problems with a Comprehend solution.You have experience working with and implementing Enterprise/SaaS applicationsYou have domain expertise around Clinical Trials (Recruitment, Study startup, CRO management, Site and Medical Monitoring, Trial Closure, Database Lock) and Clinical Trial systemsFamiliar with CDISC standards such as SDTM and mapping disparate data to an SDTM structure.Comfortable writing SQL and using BI tools to design and build analytic dashboards.You bring credibility when meeting with key customer contacts: Study Managers, Data Managers, System Admins, and ClinOps ExecutivesYou are meticulous with your verbal and written communication and communicate effectively with customers.Familiar with Data Governance, Master Data Management, and Data Quality processes/concepts.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Lead the solution design of multiple customer engagements.Support Comprehend project managers as the technical advisor on the project.Work closely with customers to understand their source systems, profile their data, and help make design decisions during the data mapping process.Participate in the analysis and mapping of customer requirements to available Comprehend applications.Define data model extensions and customizations to meet unique customer needs.Implement the Saama application through configuration and customizationCreate complex data visualizations using Saama’s analytics solutionBe available to offer technical expertise during pre-sales and post-sales activities

Required Skills

BS/BA degree or equivalent in a relevant scientific discipline with a minimum of five years experienceSound knowledge on various database conceptsAdvanced level - Database debugging and troubleshootingKnowledge of SQL and PostgreSQL, PythonDetailed knowledge of clinical database design (Rave, Oracle Clinical or Inform), proficiency with SAS data sets and conversion procedures, knowledge of MS Office program suiteKnowledge of clinical trial design and basic statistics (a plus)


Work Environment
This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment, including but not limited to, computers, phones, and photocopiers.
Physical Demands

This position requires the frequent and repetitive use of a computer, keyboard, and mouse. Hand and finger dexterity is required.
Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
EEO
Saama Technologies, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

#LI-RAJ

job_description:
Business Group Highlights

Perspecta Labs

Perspecta Labs generates transformative applied research to fuel solutions for our customers’ unique challenges. We are a self-sustaining research center within Perspecta that provides applied research and engineering to enable government agencies, utilities and commercial enterprises to fully exploit the future of communications, analytics and cyber security.

Responsibilities

Initiates the design, development, execution and implementation of technology research projects. Investigates the feasibility of applying scientific principles and concepts to potential inventions and products. Plans and executes applied research. Maintains substantial knowledge of state-of-the-art principles and theories, and may contribute to scientific literature and conferences. May participate in development of patent applications. May coordinate interdepartmental activities and research efforts.

Perspecta Labs delivers world class cmachine learning, cyber research and engineering to government agencies, telecom carriers, utilities, and commercial enterprises. Drawing on its Bell Labs heritage, Perspecta Labs excels at creating innovative technologies and services to solve the most difficult and complex problems.

We are looking for a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and proposal generation for a full-time position to lead a group of researchers in our Machine Learning and Data Analytics department. Candidates will work with teams to research, conceive, and develop prototypes, and should be adept at identifying successful approaches to complex problems. Research areas of interest include Artificial intelligence, Machine Learning, and applications of AI/ML to wireless networking, cyber security, vision, text analytics, etc.

Qualifications

Requires 12 to 15 years with BS/BA or 10 to 13 years with MS/MA or 7 to 9 years with Ph.D.

Ph.D. in Computer Science with 15+ years relevant experience in Artificial Intelligence/Machine LearningExperience in writing proposals for Government funding (e.g., DARPA), managing projects, setting direction, leading small teams of technical peopleAbility and desire to quickly acquire knowledge of new subject matter areasU.S. Citizenship required. Security clearance is desired but not required.

About Perspecta

What matters to our nation, is what matters to us. At Perspecta, everything we do, from conducting innovative research to cultivating strong relationships, supports one imperative: ensuring that your work succeeds. Our company was formed to bring a broad array of capabilities to all parts of the public sector—from investigative services and IT strategy to systems work and next-generation engineering.

Our promise is simple: never stop solving our nation’s most complex challenges. And with a workforce of approximately 14,000, more than 48 percent of which is cleared, we have been trusted to just that, as a partner of choice across the entire sector.

Perspecta is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories.

job_description:
Overview:
Jama Software provides the leading platform for requirements, risk and test management. With Jama Connect and industry-focused services, teams building complex products, systems and software improve cycle times, increase quality, reduce rework and minimize effort proving compliance. Representing the forefront of modern development, Jama's growing customer base of more than 600 organizations includes Panasonic, Boston Scientific, Lyft, Deloitte, General Dynamics, Alight and Caterpillar.

As a Senior Product Manager for New Initiatives, you will contribute directly to a critical area of our product roadmap and work with key stakeholders to help define our product innovation strategy and bring new, differentiated capabilities to market. You'll work closely with Engineering, Data Science and Product Marketing to develop concepts, test hypotheses, development prototypes and launch new products that enrich our core offerings using natural language processing, machine learning, and/or artificial intelligence to meet the business needs of our customers in regulated and unregulated industries

What you'll get to do:
Acting as primary subject matter expert and leading the product strategy and roadmap for Jama Software new initiatives

Owning and creating business cases and product requirements documentation to justify and define new initiative projects

Managing feature iteration throughout the product lifecycle

Collaborating with Product Design on concepts and prototypes, and Engineering on tool/framework evaluation to accelerate development

Developing deep understanding of client needs and market trends, through client interaction and other market research

Communicating the new initiative roadmap with key stakeholders

Education and Experience:
At least 8 years of relevant professional experience, including 5 years in software product management. Experience in enterprise software is a plus.

Proven experience in data science, natural language processing (NLP), machine learning (ML), artificial intelligence (AI) and/or analytics

Understanding of technical integrations between SaaS applications, including third-party tools/services that can accelerate innovation initiatives

Demonstrated success launching and managing highly technical, innovative products

Must be experienced at working iteratively in an agile or lean environment, and able to break down large problems into smaller valuable increments.

Must excel working self-directed, within a fast-paced incubator-like environment – individually, in small teams, or across functional groups.

While this role will collaborate with Engineering and Data Scientists for development execution, an understanding of concepts such as text representation techniques, algorithms, statistics, machine translation & compilers, machine learning frameworks and libraries, and big data frameworks (e.g. Spark or Hadoop), text classification & clustering, and syntactic & semantic parsing is a plus.

Some knowledge of Python, Java and/or ProgR, is also a plus.

Domain experience in systems engineering, particularly in regulated industries, is a plus - Our customers build life-critical hardware/software systems.

Benefits:
If we've intrigued you and you are the right candidate for the role, we will offer:

A chance to contribute to a company developing a compelling, category defining product

Challenging and fun work with a chance to make distinct, company-shaping tangible contributions

An energized, diverse and ambitious team of people on a mission

Competitive cash and equity compensation

Comprehensive and affordable medical, dental and vision plans as well as pre-tax savings accounts and a generous 401(k) employer match

Time-off and leave programs designed to meet critical needs for rejuvenation and, when needed, extra support to cope with life events

Flexible, creative workplace that includes a modern, open plan office with ample creative workspaces, monthly lunches and bagel days, a stocked kitchen and many fun events that ensure we both work hard and play hard at Jama

Jama Software is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, genetic information or that of their relatives, friends or associates or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable law.

job_description:
Being a Cloud Services Manager at iManage means…
You are responsible for the day to day iManage Cloud Customer Portfolio deployment planning, management including overall Cloud customer satisfaction and reference-ability. You will be accountable for Cloud customer account administration, support, and direction while ensuring day-to-day operational success. In addition, you will interface directly with and provide guidance to our Cloud customer's implementation services provider (iManage Partners), including key stakeholders such as the project manager, business sponsor, networking, and operations teams to ensure iManage Cloud onboarding success.
As a Cloud Services Manager, you will work closely with the internal iManage team such as Cloud Operations and Cloud Support to ensure continuity when a customer transitions from implementation to ongoing operations in the iManage Cloud.
iM Responsible For...
Providing day to day management of assigned cloud onboarding portfolio for project tasks and communications
Proactively managing the relationship with internal and outsourced iManage Cloud implementation partners and customers, including setting expectations regarding deliverables and schedules; ensuring that the project team members are effectively communicating and collaborating
Establishing and maintaining a business relationship with the iManage Cloud customer as well as the customer's implementation team to ensure customer satisfaction with the implementation; serving as the first line of response for customer escalations during implementation
Interfacing with internal iManage teams to ensure successful delivery of the components required for an iManage Cloud implementation including iManage CloudOpS, Networking, R&D, Pre-Sales, Sales, and Product Management.
Maintaining cloud-related customer data in appropriate systems including: Salesforce, DevOps, ZenDesk, etc.
Listening to customer and partner feedback and resolving any issues or conflicts
Assisting with developing relationships with onboarding customers/partners that promote retention and loyalty
Ensuring that new customers are referenceable 60 days after go-live for new deployments and upgrades
Learning and supporting iManage Cloud Product lines for customer onboarding
Educating iManage cloud implementation partners for cloud onboarding processes
Remaining current on technology and process changes as it relates to Cloud Services and Onboarding
Supporting department initiatives which include but not limited to projects such as documentation updates, reporting metrics, and net promoter scores
iM Qualified Because I have...
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Administration, Information Management, Computer Science or the equivalent
A minimum of 3-5+ Years' experience managing software implementation projects
Project Management skills
SaaS/PaaS implementation experience
Excellent business communication, organizational and project management skills
Strong computer skills
Excellent time management and decision-making skills
Bonus Points Because I have...
A working knowledge of iManage products
Used SalesForce and ticketing systems
A team player attitude; an ability to work well independently and as part of a team
A PMP certification
About iManage
iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.
So we're looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when they're solving problems and collaborating with the industry's best and brightest. In exchange, we'll make sure the work you do here is worth doing. That's the iManage way. It's how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees' strengths and unlock their potential. It's how we find meaning in everything we do.
Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

Learn more at: www.imanage.com
Please see our privacy statement for more information on how we handle your personal data: https://imanage.com/privacy-policy/

job_description:
At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules.

We’re looking for Business Development Manager, HPC Solutions to join the team.

Does this sound like a good role for you?
In this role you will oversee the development of strategic market business plans and marketing programs to support sales in HPC and adjacent market segments. You will identify strategic customers, develop relationships, formulate business strategy and support sales campaigns. This includes positioning the benefits of key Synopsys’ product features, IP portfolio, and Design Services as an integrated solution for HPC customers. You will be expected to know Synopsys products/services and orchestrate technical messaging for maximum impact in the HPC and adjacent markets. You will be the subject matter expert for your area of responsibility and be willing to work in a fast pace environment to deliver innovative solutions.

Responsibilities include:
Work with executives to developing the HPC and adjacent markets by being the subject matter expert on both the vertical and Synopsys’ tools and solutions that address that market.
Support sales enablement activities including but not limited to customer presentations, sales aids, roll out updates, feature releases etc. Participate in the development of account plans.
Work with Design Services team to deliver on solutions for the targeted customer segment. Coordinate inputs from the customer, sales, marketing and services teams to develop preliminary-proposals and SOWs. responsible for business development activities from client identification through to final invoicing.
Develop win-win customer relationships through active engagement and support e.g. issue resolution, communication, prioritization etc.
Serve as customer advocate in internal engineering forums with a goal to deliver high quality solutions.
May conduct make-versus-buy analysis from a partnership/merger/acquisition perspective.

Key Qualifications:
BS with 12+ years relevant experience.
MS with 10+ years relevant experience.
Related Ph.D. with 7+ years of relevant experience.
Requires a strong technical background in HPC design and verification.
Should also have sales (support) experience. Essential that the individual demonstrates strong communication and project management skills.

Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

#LI-TS1

Job Category

Business Development

Hire Type

Employee

Country

United States

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. Director of Sales

Synopsys, the 15th largest software company in the world, is seeking a Director of Sales to lead a team of high performance, motivated EDA sales professionals focused on expanding our business relationship with a leading edge Global customer.

This leader must be a highly motivated, proven sales executive with a track record of growing business relationships in complex situations at Tier 1 customers. The ability to inspire and lead a global team of high performance sales people will be essential. Emphasis will be placed on the ability to formulate and communicate a high level vision/strategy that motivates and enables their team to drive successful plans leading to revenue growth. The successful candidate will also possess strong executive level relationship building skills as well as the ability to work collaboratively across the organization to build consensus and drive engagement with the customer.

Responsibilities

Develop/implement overall strategy/engagement plan that drives measurable customer success with Synopsys solutions
Identify and build strong relationships with key customer influencers, executives and decision makers
Drive top-line revenue growth that is aligned with company goals
Provide strong leadership, guidance to WW sales team
Manage the business/opportunity funnel consistent with targeted goals
Lead a collaborative culture that enables consensus and commitment across the organization to drive targeted initiatives aimed at expansion of Synopsys solutions
Key Qualifications

Minimum 10 -12+ years of successful technology related sales (EDA) or business development
Proven track record of exceeding software sales revenue/business plans
Excellent leadership skills with a proven ability to motivate, attract, develop and maintain a high performance sales team
Proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships with executive decision-makers
Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communications and presentations skills
B of EE/CS or equivalent

job_description:
Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required plus a minimum of 8 years relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 6 years relevant experience to meet managerial expectations.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
The ability to obtain a Department of Defense TS/SCI security clearance is required at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Responsibilities for this Position:
The responsibility is career-defining. So is the opportunity. At General Dynamics Mission Systems, we invent the technologies, products and services, that help our nation’s heroes keep our nation safe. The work is so advanced, our teams regularly redefine innovation and excellence for the world. If you’re looking for a challenge, you’ve just found it.

We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


As a seasoned team leader, you’ll use proposal plans and strategies to lead a team in developing, defining, and implementing cohesive, integrated program/product, subcontractor, and material plans, and business plans that achieve overall current and long-term objectives of the program/product, business unit, and division. The Program Manager will identify needed resources for projects, define and assign major program roles, lead the establishment of and sets integrated WBS-based budget and schedule baselines, and monitor work accomplished to baseline plans to ensure rate of work completion is sufficient to meet program/product schedules. We’ll rely on you to balance program risks and opportunities with executable strategies to meet technical requirements and budgets, as well as manage people who lead cross-functional program teams in matrix organization that are focused on the delivery of a product or software solutions from design to release for customers.


What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent plus a minimum of 8 years relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 6 years relevant experience to meet managerial expectations
Strong knowledge of products and technologies including current and potential applications
Skilled in the development and implementation of product/program strategy and tactics
Exceptional communication skills to relay issues, impacts, and corrective actions on programs to internal and external representatives
Experience managing programs and delivering software solutions to customers
What sets you apart:
Creative thinking with the ability to multi-task
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

job_description:
Software Architect / Development Lead - Chicago


Company Description

RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.

RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.

We are a problem-solving company. Technology is just our tool.

The Role

The Software Architect / Development Lead is a hands-on role responsible for architecting and driving the development our low code, highly configurable SaaS product. This product incorporates leading-edge technologies, from cloud-based mobility to data visualizations and artificial intelligence. This role involves close coordination with the product owner and other key members of the product development organization.

Day to Day Activities Include

Envisioning and architecting innovative solutions for complex problems, leveraging advanced understanding of software engineering principles.

Leading technical product design sessions, prototype work, and proofs-of-concept.

Hands-on analysis, design, and development to enable further product scalability and interoperability.

Leading an engineering team of developers in an Agile Scrum environment.

Working with the product owner to remove obstacles, review design, and ensure releases meets the needs of stakeholders.

Mentoring team members in design, coding practices, and software development policies and guidelines.

Actively contributing to software development design and coding standards.

Verifying all completed work follows best practices and engineering standards.

Supporting cross-functional teams in testing, deploying, and implementing the product.

Monitoring and evaluating industry trends and third-party tools.

Preferred Qualifications

8+ years of experience in software development as a full stack developer.

2+ years of engineering leadership experience, preferably in a C#, .NET, and SQL Server environment.

2+ architecting application, product, and/or platform solutions, preferably in a cloud/Azure environment.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to individuals with varying levels of technical understanding.

Highly self-motivated with the ability to work independently.

Proven ability to efficiently learn and apply new ideas and concepts.

Ability to organize time, staff, and projects efficiently.

Required Qualifications

All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:

A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.

A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.

We Offer You

RedMane has a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm.

We believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.

Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.

A security clearance is required.

SphereOI helps clients succeed with advanced data analytics. Our custom framework creates purpose-driven competitive differentiators by linking advanced analytics technology to business opportunities and portfolio strategy. We keep the focus on what is most important as we work with clients to give them the practical skills to stand on their own in developing the future.

This position is for a System Administrator who will be responsible for operating, maintaining, and sustaining enterprise Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) and physical server environments. The person in this position will support enterprise systems which will involve working with system users, network administrators, software developers, and other team members to define problems, and design solutions. This position over time will draw on skills in Citrix, VMWare, Microsoft Hyper-V, and Linux administration.

 What You Will Be Doing
Provide O&M and engineering support for enterprise operations.
Troubleshoot problems and work with users and the technical team on a resolution.
Provision and configure Linux virtual machines.
Support ESXi server migrations and upgrades.
Manage license files, routing tables, and firewall configurations.
Evaluate vendor products and provide recommendations.
Develop policies and procedures for monitoring enterprise systems.

 What You Need for this Position
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical experience.
Hands-on experience administering Windows and Unix servers.
Hands-on experience with Citrix or VMWare is a plus.
Security+ or ITIL certification is a plus.

About SphereOI Studios:

SphereOI Studios is an award winning digital studio that develops data responsive solutions with deep analytics and artificial intelligence. We believe that data science that aligns with business value can increase market share and pricing power, enhance customer engagement or completely transform a product category. We fuse data strategy with data science and design driven innovation to create customer technologies for commercial and federal customers.

job_description:
Job Requirements


We are looking for a curious and motivated Product Manager to join our team. Product Managers will be working in a high energy, crazy-fun, and agile team environment. It's fast-paced, and you will have personal accountability to move your product forward. We’re proud to offer employees a flexible work structure a﻿nd value responsibility to own things through to completion.

Phenom Product Managers will use industry and product research to analyze trends inside and outside the recruiting space to drive new product development. You will be responsible for authoring epic level feature requirements as well as shepherding the story writing process with UI/UX to convey how end users may be expected to use our products and platform. You will be working closely with the product engineering team and executive team to drive the future growth of the platform and company.

Product managers work closely with sales, customer success and implementation teams to gather customer/prospect feedback. You will be organizing and conducting product interviews with customers, recruiters, hiring managers, talent acquisition executives, industry thought leaders and more to help identify the areas our platform will best serve their needs. Product managers also propose new features and products that fill market gaps and help us grow.

Work Experience


Experience interfacing with customers or development teams
Experience with JIRA or equivalent product development management tools
Storytelling and vision setting skills
Proficiency with Agile/Scrum/Kanban development methodologies
Knowledge of the recruiting/talent acquisition industry
Experience working with international teams
Experience at a startup/fast paced environment
Background in or experience with project/product management
Experience managing enterprise platforms that enable a suite of products
Experience building self serve tools that simplify technical configuration and implementation process
 5-7 years of relevant industry work experience

Expectations and Tasks

Curiosity - We’re creating something entirely new. You’ll need to be able to let your curiosity drive you with an open mind.

Drive - You’ll be put in a position to succeed, but you’ll need to drive yourself. This is a hard job, but an immensely rewarding one.

Flexibility - We move fast, and things change often. Be open to change and find ways to capitalize on your ability to move forward and get things done.

Organization - You’ll need to have excellent organization skills to keep track of various projects and touchpoints with cross functional teams across time zones.

Customer Focused -Strive to deliver the best customer focused product experience.

Bachelor’s Degree Preferred

Benefits

About Phenom People

Phenom People is the leader in Talent Experience Management (TXM). We’re a fast-growing startup on a mission to help a billion people find the right job. As a category creator, our goal is to educate talent leaders on the benefits of TXM and how it helps solve the pain points for candidates, recruiters, employees, and management.

We’re also an awesome place to work: Among many other honors, we have been awarded Philadelphia’s Top Work Places for 2019 by Philly Mag, #1 Best Company Outlook in PA in 2019 by Comparably, and #5 in Inc. 5000's Best Workplaces in the Greater Philadelphia Area in 2018.

Phenom People delivers the Phenom Talent Experience Management (TXM) platform to transform the talent journey from interested candidates to thriving employees to enthusiastic brand advocates, while helping HR break the stereotype of being a cost center instead of a revenue generator.

Redefining the entire talent experience through a single platform approach, Phenom’s TXM platform provides companies with a unified solution which delivers a Career Site, CRM, CMS, Chatbot, SMS, Internal Mobility & Referrals, University Recruiting, Talent Analytics, and AI. Our platform is built on artificial intelligence (AI), which drives personalization, automation, and accuracy for candidates, recruiters, employees, and management.

We believe people should be happy and inspired by their jobs—just as we are. That simple belief fuels our collective desire to fundamentally transform the talent journey, and achieve our mission to help a billion people find the right

Disclaimer

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
