job_title: Sr. Principal Signal Image Processing Engineer
job_description:
At Northrop Grumman we develop cutting-edge technology that preserves freedom and advances human discovery. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We continue to innovate with developments from launching the first commercial flight to space, to discovering the early beginnings of the universe. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

The Engineering and Sciences (E&S) organization pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines engineering capabilities, and drives advances in various sciences. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to develop, design, produce and sustain optimized product lines across the sector while providing a decisive advantage to the warfighter. Come be a part of our mission!

The Algorithmic Warfare team at Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is looking for you to join our team as a Sr. Principal Signal Image Processing Engineer based out of Woodland Hills, CA.

What You'll get to Do:

Design signal processing algorithms to extract signals from noisy data.Probe large quantities of sensor data to uncover, understand, and exploit complex phenomenology.Develop and apply artificial intelligence and machine learning approaches to accomplish mission objectives.Prototype algorithms in MATLAB, IDL, Python, C, and/or C++.Measure algorithm performance as applied to a variety of sensor data.Collaborate with a software engineering team to facilitate algorithm implementation in real-time code.Present technical progress at technical review meetings, and documenting results via written reports.
WOODLANDHILLS

Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline with 9 years of technical experience; Master's Degree with 7 years of technical experience; PhD with 0 years experience.Demonstrated success developing technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity.Must be a U.S. citizen with the ability to obtain a DoD Top Secret clearance.

Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in any of the following areas is highly desired: data analysis, artificial intelligence, machine learning, signal processing, statistical decision theory, detection and tracking, classification, modeling and simulation, and algorithm development, particularly as applied to complex sensor systems.Experience with remote sensing data, such as radar, EO/IR, multi or hyper-spectral, acoustics.Proficiency with scientific prototyping languages such as MATLAB, IDL, Python, or Mathematica. Familiarity with signal processing algorithm design and implementation in C or C++, and real-time parallel processing.

What We Can Offer You:

Northrop Grumman provides a comprehensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages your growth and supports the mutual success of our people and our company. Northrop Grumman benefits give you the flexibility and control to choose the benefits that make the most sense for you and your family. Your package will include the following:

What We Can Offer You:

job_description:
Implementation Manager

Services – Austin, Texas


Iodine Software equips healthcare teams with the most innovative tools to solve some of their toughest problems in clinical documentation. By leveraging new technologies like Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence, our platform drives significant improvements in how hospitals document patient health conditions, in turn positively influencing team performance and patient outcomes.


Our client base is growing rapidly, and we need talented, dedicated individuals to help drive our continued success. Our Implementation Managers are responsible for the success of our customer deployments. They are tech-savvy, resourceful individuals with the ability to make quick connections and foster client relationships at all levels of an organization, from executives to end-users. If you are passionate about problem solving, focused on driving results, are a respected collaborator, and consider yourself a technologist at heart, this position may be right for you.


What You’ll Do


Serve as both project manager and technical expert on implementations of Iodine Software solutions
Synthesize and understand complex data sets from new clients and ensure client information is mapped to the Iodine system
Configure, test, and deploy hosted customer implementations of our software
Assist in the deployment of upgrades of our software for entire client base
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to continuously improve the offering
Partner with client success team to ensure solutions are aligned with long-term strategy
Lead customer calls and meetings
Identify dependencies and communicate consistently with project team to ensure smooth & timely deployments
Provide ongoing business and technical support to existing customers
Work with marketing, development, and sales as needed to continuously improve customer satisfaction


What You’ll Need


Bachelor’s degree from a relevant program, with strong record of academic achievement
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Strong attention to detail, highly organized with an absolute focus on quality
1+ years’ experience with software implementations
Proven track record of managing multiple, competing priorities while consistently exceeding goals
Advanced Excel skills
Knowledge of XML, SQL, HTML and Java strongly preferred; HL7 experience is a plus
Outstanding oral and written communication skills
Proven ability to adapt to different environments, build strong relationships, and influence others positively
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple work streams simultaneously and efficiently
Team player DNA with a desire to solve for the interests of our clients and of our business
Positive, self-starter attitude with desire to exceed expectations and ability to work extended hours when necessary
Attention to detail, highly organized, with an absolute focus on quality of work
Ability to travel up to 15%, if necessary


What You’ll Get:


This is a unique opportunity to join a close-knit, rapidly growing team and help us build and scale our services organization. You will be learning the latest technologies that are pushing the boundaries of our industry and impacting the way medical teams document patient health conditions. You will be a first point of client contact, directly influencing the way clients experience our product and our team. You will interface with all aspects of the business and have exposure to many learning opportunities – from implementation management to machine learning analysis to software development.


See Something, Do Something


At Iodine, we are incredibly privileged to be entrusted with an enormous amount of Protected Health Information (PHI) amounting more than 90 million lives. Inherent to our culture is the need to live up to that trust in everything we do. Security is a primary responsibility shared by every Iodine employee and we expect everyone to honor that responsibility. That includes abiding by our security policies, being constantly vigilant to possible risks to the privacy and safety of the information given to our care and bringing forward any concerns about security.


You must be currently authorized to work full-time in the United States on a permanent basis.

job_description:
Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
About us……..
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsIQ™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning, and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with application of analytics to sales and marketing problems such as:-
Commercial Model Design, Sales Force Sizing and Structure
Patient analytics using Real-World Data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, lab/diagnostic testing data, etc.
Segmentation, Targeting, , Promotion Response Modeling, Marketing Mix Optimization, Digital Analytics
Market Access Analytics incl. pull-through analysis, Payer-plan segmentation, Rebate optimization, etc
Territory Alignment, Sales Call Planning, Incentive Compensation
Responsibilities: -
Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals.
Leverage and customize Axtria's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project.
Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery.
Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions.
Make presentations and recommendations to clients on optimal customer, sales and marketing strategies and tactics.
Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics.
Contribute to Axtria's development of new solutions and analytical models.
Recruit, manage and mentor a team of analysts
Required Skills/Experience: -
A degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field with 6-10 years of prior relevant work experience. Graduate degree is preferred.
Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, ProgR, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, and able to quickly master new packages when needed
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language.
Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results.
Ability to lead projects and teams
Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and / or optimization techniques
Exposure to / experience working with large data sets.
Familiarity / expertise in using Pharmaceutical data sets such a prescriber-plan data, patient level data, transactional claims, EMR/EHR data, SPP Hub data, diagnostic data etc. is a plus.
Logistics and Location: Thousand Oaks, CA

job_description:
Overview
Are you passionate about bringing AI (artificial intelligence) services into our daily lives? We are looking for product managers to bring their ideas to life and to build AI services for Samsung’s suite of devices including mobile, speakers, wearables, etc. In this position, you will be part of a collaborative team of world-class researchers and engineers in the field of AI technologies, encompassing voice assistant, computer vision, AR/VR, and robotics.
Come join the Samsung Bixby team and be part of the future of AI services. The position will be initially focused on voice services as well as new use cases that delight our consumers in the areas of voice and vision.
Position Summary:
The Product Manager will join the Global Product Management team. The Bixby global team works closely with global teams in Korea and local teams in Mountain View and San Jose across various internal organizations – including business, engineering, architecture, and linguists – to define requirements and roadmaps for Samsung Bixby. This product manager will champion the product design and realization from inception to launch and post-launch.
Responsibilities:
Contributing to the vision and strategy of our overall products and services.

Acting as Product Owner to drive clarity of the product to meet commercial and strategic goals.

Defining and articulating use cases/features/requirements for features that have been proposed.

Ensuring that features/requirements meet certain entry criteria before assignment to a release.

Soliciting and formalizing feedback from business teams and technology partners.

Ensuring adherence to Product Management processes related to change control, documentation, etc.

Company:

Samsung

Qualifications:

College degree in Computer Science or similar. MBA preferred.

5+ years of product management experience.

Strong market analysis skills.

Empathize deeply with our customers and advcatate for their needs

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Team player with exceptional time management skills.

Proven previous experience in end-to-end product lifecycle (concept through deployment and maintenance) is required.

Technical and business confidence to assert and/or defend positions regarding definition and priority of features.

Proactive, self-starter with the ability to multi-task and work independently at all levels in the organization.

Able to travel internationally (<25%).
Educational level:

Diploma

Level of experience (years):

Senior (5+ years of experience)

job_description:
Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required plus a minimum of 2 years relevant experience; or a Master's degree.


CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required within a reasonable period of time. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Responsibilities for this Position:
Help make the technologies, products and services that make a difference. That’s the opportunity that’s waiting for you at General Dynamics Mission Systems. We help our nation’s heroes keep our nation safe by creating solutions so advanced, they redefine innovation for the world. It’s an amazing challenge. And it’s waiting for you now.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


As a Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) project manager, you will develop cohesive project plans, authorize work, manage costs, schedules and the technical performance of projects (products or services). You’ll essentially organize interdepartmental activities to ensure that projects are completed on schedule and within budget by leading department or cross-functional project teams in matrix organization to achieve schedule, cost, and technical performance objectives. You’ll also identify issues, track progress, and follow through on corrective actions.


What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent plus a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience; or a Master's degree
Earned Value Management or scheduling tool knowledge
Solid knowledge of work estimating, allocation, scheduling, and authorization
Solid organizational, analysis, and time management skills, attention to detail and accuracy, and ability to multi-task high priorities
What sets you apart:
Creative thinking with the ability to resolve problems
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation

job_description:
Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required plus a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required within a reasonable period of time. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Responsibilities for this Position:
Ready to be a leader with the company that is committed to pushing the limits of truly advanced technologies? At General Dynamics Mission Systems, we create the products and services that help our service members, intelligence analysts and first responders keep our nation safe. The work we do is so advanced, it’s often classified. If you want to put your talent in the spotlight, it’s waiting for you right now, right here.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


As a seasoned team leader, the Senior Project Manager will develop and implement product strategies and roadmaps for a specific target product by analyzing markets and drive/maintain product acceptance in the market by integrating the work of research and development, manufacturing, marketing, sales, and service functions to solve market problems to meet corporate business objectives relating to revenue, margin, quality, and time-to-market. You’ll interface with customers to gain and maintain market specific knowledge and understanding of product use to formulate their requirements in a Market/Product Requirements Document and work with the marketing team in activities related to the products including competitive analysis and pricing, product requirements, development of marketing materials, and analysis of market trends. We’ll rely on you to use proposal plans and strategies to develop, define, and implement cohesive, integrated program, subcontractor, and material plans that achieve overall current and long term objectives of the program, business unit, and division, as well as develop WBS and WBS dictionary as baseline for scope definition and effective integrated cost/schedule management of the project.

What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent plus a minimum of 5 years relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 3 years relevant experience
Exceptional organizational, analysis, and time management skills, attention to detail and accuracy, and ability to multi-task high priorities
Fully proficient ability to identify issues, track progress, and follow through on effective corrective actions based on data analysis and trends
Ability to develop and implement a product-oriented WBS and WBS Dictionary
Earned Value Management and scheduling tool experience
What sets you apart:
Creative thinking with the ability to resolve issues
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

job_description:
Who we are looking for

Rev.com is looking for a Sales Manager to join our growing sales team. This is an opportunity for a proven leader to build and scale a team to drive incredible results. You will be responsible for building and coaching a team, enabling them to sell, and driving new business.

You will also be responsible for articulating the value proposition relevant to the target audience, generating leads and sales opportunities, and closing deals to generate revenue. The ideal candidate will have experience in a high-growth/start-up technology environment. You will report into Rev's Head of Sales


You Will

Drive the team to exceed revenue targets through new client acquisition and install base expansion
Own pipeline for the entire Sales organization and run forecasts
Build and develop a sales team that is successful in identifying, qualifying, developing and closing new business
Build a culture of continued success and goal achievement through talent management, feedback, mentoring and training
Thoroughly understand the ins and outs of the AE team pipeline and accurately forecast bookings.
Lead the AE team with a consistent vision of the future.
Understand what the data is telling you to diagnose problems within the pipeline and propose solutions on how to solve those problems.
Collaborate with other teams including business development, customer success, marketing, product, finance, and legal to ensure the long-term success of the AE team.
Consistently coach AEs to improve their sales skills over time.
Successfully onboard and train new AEs as our sales team grows.


Qualifications

7+ years of sales experience.
3+ years of Sales leadership experience at high-growth B2B SaaS companies
Strong track record of leading AE teams to consistently exceeding sales targets.
Team-oriented - Customer acquisition happens through a focused effort from sales, marketing, product, engineering, finance, and legal. We're a highly collaborative organization.
Great understanding of contract negotiation and working with procurement, legal, and finance teams.
Experience working with SalesForce, Outreach.io, Linkedin Sales Navigator, Zoominfo, and other sales tools.


This might not work if

You struggle with ambiguity and change.
Don't thrive in complex environments dealing with multiple stakeholders.
Data driven decisions are not in your playbook.
About Rev

Rev.com is a successful growth-stage startup, headquartered in San Francisco, with a second office in downtown Austin. Founded in 2010 by MIT engineers, Rev has raised millions of dollars in venture capital from top Silicon Valley VCs.

Recently named to America's Most Promising Artificial Intelligence Companies , Rev is shaping the way people work with AI. Rev is a marketplace for remote work with the mission to create 1 million work-from-home jobs by 2025. We currently have a network of 50,000 freelancers (Revvers) around the globe and have well over 150,000+ customers, including companies like Amazon, Google, Airbnb, and more.

Rev's services include audio transcription, video captions, document translations, and automatic speech recognition. Learn more about Rev on our "about us" page and check out our thousands of 5-star reviews.
job_description_requirements: This is an opportunity for a proven leader to build and scale a team to drive incredible results.  The ideal candidate will have experience in a high-growth/start-up technology environment.  7+ years of sales experience.  3+ years of Sales leadership experience at high-growth B2B SaaS companies.  Strong track record of leading AE teams to consistently exceeding sales targets.  Experience working with SalesForce, Outreach

job_description:
Basic Qualifications :
Associate’s degree in related discipline or equivalent is required plus a minimum of 7 years of relevant experience.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Responsibilities for this Position:
Imagine a world-class engineering environment. Now add a team of exceptional talent along with technologies that are so advanced they’re often classified. That’s what you’ll find at General Dynamics Mission Systems. Here you’ll lead amazing engineers as they invent the technologies, products and services that help our service members, intelligence analysts and first responders keep our nation safe. If you want the chance to lead, it’s time to bring your talent to General Dynamics Mission Systems.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


The Principal Engineering Technician will act as a leader and mentor to new technicians, by providing technical expertise in problem analysis and solutions utilizing complex instrumentation and software. This will entail performing a wide variety of the most complex technical tasks to support, design, develop, modify and improve equipment, tools, processes, product, procedure and documentation. We seek a leader open to new ideas that will serve as a champion for change.


REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES AND TASKS:
Performs wide variety of the most complex technical tasks to support, design, develop, modify and improve equipment, tools, processes, product, procedure and documentation
Provide technical expertise in problem analysis and solutions utilizing complex instrumentation and software
Researches and evaluates comprehensive technical material
Analyzes results and implements procedures for problem resolution
Assists in the development of new/revised product and programs
Improvises, adapts, creates operating procedures to enhance quality, cycle time and customer satisfaction
Technical support lead in the development of prototypes
Trainer for less skilled technical personnel
Can be expected to lead, direct, organize Technician work
Works with associates and other departments and participates in cross-functional relationships
Develops test specifications and procedures as required
Prepares reports, documentation/specifications as required

REQUIREMENTS
Experience in Development and Implementation of New Processes in support of system testing, to include documenting, the processes performed during test article build.
Design and Procurement of Tooling and Equipment.
Responsible for Development and Deployment of Manufacturing Processes. Including;
Development of Detailed Process Work Instructions, Material Resource Planning, Shop
Floor Control, Process Team Leadership.
Control of Non-Conforming Material, Risk Identification and Mitigation, and implementation of Preventive and Corrective Action.
Interface with Design Engineers to evaluate New Product Design for Manufacturability and survivability of system deployment.
Setup facilities and equipment for the building of High Reliability Undersea Fiber Optic Hardware.
Develop and Implement Process Quality Goals and Performance Measurement Tools.
Analyze Process Performance Results and Deploy Responsive Action to ensure that Quality and performance goals are met.

KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
As a highly skilled specialist, contributes to the development of concepts and techniques
Completes complex tasks in creative and effective ways
Ability to generate documents, spreadsheet data analysis, test software and complex block
diagram creation
Understands technologies available to conduct business, when to use them and how to access them for business support
Ability to reuse technologies between multiple programs
Consistently works on complex assignments requiring independent action and a high degree of initiative to resolve issues
Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new assignments
Provides direction to other employees with similar duties as required.
Often acts as a facilitator and team leader
Proficient in the application and interpretation of complex specifications, requirements, contracts, policies, standards and practices
Proficient in prioritizing and maintaining effective technical support of multiple tasks and assignments
Obtain certification in overhead Crane and forklift operation for the lifting and moving of heavy material.
Proficient and safe operation of power tools, hand tools and equipment required to build test articles.
Knowledge of optical test equipment for the measurement of optical conditions.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
Shows initiative on assignments, exercises independent judgment and professionally executes projects with little direction

What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
An Associate’s degree in related discipline or equivalent plus a minimum of 7 years of relevant experience
Contributes to the development of concepts and techniques in creative and effective ways
Ability to generate documents, spreadsheet data analysis, test software and complex block diagram creation
Fully proficient in the application and interpretation of complex specifications, requirements, contracts, policies, standards and practices
What sets you apart:
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Leads by initiative and example
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

Commitment to ongoing professional development

job_description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of technical leadership and people management experience.
Programming experience in one of the following: Java, C++ or Python.

Preferred qualifications:

PhD in Computer Science or closely related degree.
10 years of relevant industry experience.
5 years of technical leadership and people management experience.
Large scale systems design experience.
About the job
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started - and as a manager, you guide the way.
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities
Manage a team of software engineers, including task planning and code reviews.
Drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
Take responsibility for the overall planning, execution and success of complex technical projects.
Contribute technically to projects.
Work closely with product management team to ensure we're building the best products.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Large scale systems design experience

job_description:
Associate Director, Global Contract Lead



Description
Developing innovative therapies is one of the most challenging, most essential and personally rewarding fields in science. This is the most exciting time to be a part of Astellas, a company with a uniquely collaborative and patient-focused culture.

There's something special about working at Astellas. It's reflected in our focus on the people we serve, the way we treat each other and the results we achieve together as a company.

Astellas is announcing an Associate Director, Global Contract Lead opportunity in Northbrook, IL.


Purpose & Scope:

The role will support the entire Procurement category and sourcing teams in efficient commercial contract management. The role will have the following key goals:

Enhance value of sourcing activities by create a standardized contract management process that is tailored to each geography
Create a process and technology backbone to ensure a seamless and smooth process of creating, negotiating, storing and retrieving contracts
Provide sound contracting practices and ensure compliance with Astellas policies and procedures
Working with other key functions (in particular, Legal and Global Business Services) to develop a global contracting operating model which effectively manages risk whilst delivering optimum agility and efficiency


Essential Job Responsibilities:

The role will enable the Global Category Management and Technology Lead as well as the entire Sourcing and Category teams by establishing a centralized and standardized (yet customized by region) contracting process as well as creating a easy to use repository of contracts. The role will have following key responsibilities:

Create an end to end global operating model and process of contract management that is standardized as much as possible taking into account regional nuances. This will include :
Implement and co-develop procedures for contract management and administration in compliance with company policy
Develop, own and deliver a globally standardized support model which delivers end-to-end ownership of the contracting process including all administration and negotiation
Developing and maintaining standard contracting templates and playbooks (along with legal) which both mitigate risk and drive agility
Develop a technology strategy which builds on and enhances the current myContract platform including the use of Robotic Process Automation and Artificial Intelligence
Coaching the category and sourcing managers on the process
Ensure appropriate contract close-out, extension, or renewal protocols
Ensure that the contract management process is being followed. Monitor compliance by company employees with established procedures
Work with Procurement Technology Lead to develop a technology strategy which builds on and enhances the current myContract platform including the use of advanced capabilities such as Robotic Process Automation and Artificial Intelligence
Establish an audit process to not only ensure compliance to contracting process but also to ensure compliance to contracts and as such, offer improved risk mitigation and incremental commercial value
Provide all categories and business stakeholders with a 'Contract as a Service' approach in order to both reduce touch points and provide increased speed/cycle time reduction
Own end-to-end Contract Life Cycle Management activities including proactive renewals and effective management of data to support wider business change activities
Primary point of contact with Legal and responsible for incorporating and communicating all legal advice and input
Work closely with Supplier Risk Lead in order to provide required inputs to a seamless Supplier Risk program
Consult key stakeholders and own the contracting continuous improvement plan along with all necessary change management and training requirements


Quantitative Dimensions:

Develop an operating model to negotiate, manage and store in excess of 10,000 commercial contracts per annum, covering a spend of $3.7bn
Ownership of all resources dedicated to the Contract Management process (Administration and Negotiation) - currently consists of 21 resources (BPO, Interim and Permanent). Exact number will be reviewed as part of Operating Model delivery
Ad-Hoc Management: With the support of key stakeholders, will interact and lead multi-functional teams
Travel: Key area of the role will be to support with, align and influence Global/Regional stakeholders and therefore, global/regional travel will be required (~20% of role)


Organizational Context:

Key Relationships:

Legal Department
Global Business Services - in particular, Global and Regional P2P Leads
Category Leads
Category Managers
All Business Stakeholders who may be involved in commercial contracts
Reports to: Global Category Management & Technology Lead


Requirements
Qualifications:

Required

Minimum Qualification

Degree required
3+ years of Experience in procurement contracting activities
Fluency in English conversational and business English (equivalent to TOEFL iBT 105+, or 7.5 IELTS, CAE- Cambridge English advanced exam)


Minimum Experience

Strong organization skills
Experience with information systems
Comfortable working with contracts
General working knowledge and competency in Microsoft packages and Source to Pay systems
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills (multiple complex analyses simultaneously)
Good planning/project management skills
Evidence of developing innovative commercial solutions using a wide range of value levers


Job specific skills (behavioral)

High energy, enthusiastic
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills - important to build relationships, trust and to become respected by the business teams
Strong oral and written communication and presentation skills
Strong problem solving skills
Strong implementation skills. Able to interpret business requirements and effectively align inputs, outputs and results
Makes good and timely decisions that move the organization forward, based upon a mixture of facts, analysis, experience and judgement
Builds strong customer relationships and delivers customer centric solutions
Ability to handle multiple projects at the same time and close advanced projects on time with minimal supervision
Operates well under ambiguity and able to effectively maneuver through complex policy, process and people related issues
Must be a good team player - willing and able to assist peers in Global Procurement and able to work in multi-functional, cross-regional teams


Preferred

Legal experience
MBA

#LI-DC1

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Type Full-time

Location IL, Northbrook

Category Finance

job_description:
Who we are looking for

Rev.com is looking for a Sales Manager to join our growing sales team. This is an opportunity for a proven leader to build and scale a team to drive incredible results. You will be responsible for building and coaching a team, enabling them to sell, and driving new business.

You will also be responsible for articulating the value proposition relevant to the target audience, generating leads and sales opportunities, and closing deals to generate revenue. The ideal candidate will have experience in a high-growth/start-up technology environment. You will report into Rev's Head of Sales


You Will

Drive the team to exceed revenue targets through new client acquisition and install base expansion
Own pipeline for the entire Sales organization and run forecasts
Build and develop a sales team that is successful in identifying, qualifying, developing and closing new business
Build a culture of continued success and goal achievement through talent management, feedback, mentoring and training
Thoroughly understand the ins and outs of the AE team pipeline and accurately forecast bookings
Lead the AE team with a consistent vision of the future
Understand what the data is telling you to diagnose problems within the pipeline and propose solutions on how to solve those problems.
Collaborate with other teams including business development, customer success, marketing, product, finance, and legal to ensure the long-term success of the AE team
Consistently coach AEs to improve their sales skills over time
Successfully onboard and train new AEs as our sales team grows


Qualifications

7+ years of sales experience
3+ years of Sales leadership experience at high-growth B2B SaaS companies
Strong track record of leading AE teams to consistently exceeding sales targets
Team-oriented - Customer acquisition happens through a focused effort from sales, marketing, product, engineering, finance, and legal. We're a highly collaborative organization
Great understanding of contract negotiation and working with procurement, legal, and finance teams
Experience working with SalesForce, Outreach.io, Linkedin Sales Navigator, Zoominfo, and other sales tools


This might not work if

You struggle with ambiguity and change
Don't thrive in complex environments dealing with multiple stakeholders
Data driven decisions are not in your playbook


About Rev

Rev.com is a successful growth-stage startup, headquartered in San Francisco, with a second office in downtown Austin. Founded in 2010 by MIT engineers, Rev has raised millions of dollars in venture capital from top Silicon Valley VCs.

Recently named to America's Most Promising Artificial Intelligence Companies , Rev is shaping the way people work with AI. Rev is a marketplace for remote work with the mission to create 1 million work-from-home jobs by 2025. We currently have a network of 50,000 freelancers (Revvers) around the globe and have well over 150,000+ customers, including companies like Amazon, Google, Airbnb, and more.

Rev's services include audio transcription, video captions, document translations, and automatic speech recognition. Learn more about Rev on our "about us" page and check out our thousands of 5-star reviews.

The ideal candidate will have experience in a high-growth/start-up technology environment.  7+ years of sales experience.  3+ years of Sales leadership experience at high-growth B2B SaaS companies.  Strong track record of leading AE teams to consistently exceeding sales targets.  Experience working with SalesForce, Outreach

job_description:
Director, Oracle Partner Network-20000G6H


No Visa Sponsorship is available for this position.

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English

Preferred Qualifications

The race is on! Emerging technologies like artificial intelligence, autonomous, mobility, and IoT have changed the way business structured with all things digital and their expectation of immediacy and value.


To meet the customers’ needs today and exceed their expectations for tomorrow, Oracle is laser-focused to empower and accelerate companies around the world to respond to customer’s cloud transformation with solutions “Powered By” or “Integrated With” Oracle Cloud Platform, or with services to plan, implement, and manage their “last upgrade” transformation or modernization efforts.


The Oracle PartnerNetwork (OPN), a programmatic effort to enable our partner ecosystem, provides the tools, education, and assistance critical in accelerating the delivery of Cloud solutions or services to assist our mutual customers.

Oracle is looking for a Director, OPN Program Lead to join our dynamic team. We are seeking a passionate, results-oriented, proven individual with experience in the innovation and management of global partner programs. This is a highly visible role across the organization and is an opportunity to make a lasting impact on the growth and success of our customers, our partner ecosystem, and Oracle.

The successful candidate must have proven experience and success in working collaboratively across executive management, field sales organization, product development, marketing, etc. They will be passionate about their work, self-motivated, detail oriented and have excellent problem-solving abilities. Additionally, they will have superb communication and project management skills, communicate progress and results both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand way.

The ideal candidate will possess an extensive background working with technology partnerships and partner programs, particularly as related to Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Strategic Implementers (SIs), along with strong business development, strategic alliances, and entrepreneurial skills. He/she should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about new business models, solution selling, and technical challenges to help build and convey compelling value propositions for Oracle customers with our partners. The candidate should also have a proven track record of influencing innovation through a partner ecosystem with a prior solution and program successes.
Key Responsibilities:
 Own programmatic elements of Partner Tracks of the Oracle PartnerNetwork working horizontally and vertically with various LOBs/development organizations
 Build and analyze valuable benefit packages for members of OPN
 Drive awareness of new or updated program information for internal partner facing teams and OPN Partner ecosystem through established vehicles
 Engage OPN program members directly to gain insight on the user experience of the program
 Evaluate effectiveness and propose adjustments to programs to improve performance and ensure objectives are met
 Promote online Oracle partner communities to drive recruitment and market adoption
 Analyze adoption rates and recommend enhancements on a continual basis
 Maintain a positive, proactive attitude, always exercise great judgment and demonstrate the ability to initiate new programs and obtain senior management buy-in and support.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
 Bachelors Degree Required. MBA or another advanced college degree preferred
 7-10+ years in program development for a global technology company, e.g., AWS, Microsoft, Cisco, Salesforce, Oracle. Experience working on MSP and/or SI program development strongly preferred
 In-depth knowledge of the cloud computing industry
 Experience and success in managing large and complex global partner ecosystems with a proven understanding of the various business models
 Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
 Clear track record of delivering programs that accelerate sales revenue and customer success.
 Proven ability to partner with a wide variety of senior-level individuals including top-level business leaders and customers.
 Strong business acumen, and experience with large, complex organizations during periods of rapid growth and change.
 Resilient and able to thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment with a high level of energy.
 Advanced Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel skills (Pivot Tables, Macros).
 Willing to travel domestically and internationally to meet with customers, partners, as needed.

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Engages in business development strategies and programs in support of Oracle's Sales Organization.

Oversees the development of strategic market/product line business plans and marketing programs to support sales in designated market segments. Engages in many areas of business development to include strategy, programs, demand generation, building pipeline, increasing deal size, and account planning. Analyzes market data to identify trends/opportunities and develops strategic direction from market information. Identifies volume and strategic customers. Primary interaction is with Oracle sales force; however, may interact with external customers as it relates to the development and facilitation of ongoing business and/or business relationship. Supports the business by interfacing with the sales organization and other internal groups (such as Product Development, Operations, GBUs, Marketing, etc.)

Acknowledged authority within the Corporation. Acts as a leader of large-scale company initiatives. Viewed by peers as a leader and top contributor and by line management as a key business partner. 12+ years of Marketing/Business Development experience in the technology industry, preferably software industry. Experience should include relationship management. Conversant in Oracle technology and product strategies. Ability to determine strategy and tactical plans that deliver tangible results. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. BA/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.

Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Opportunity: Sr. Systems Administrator / DOD - Aerospace / Fairfax, VA

Overview:
Our clientengineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

Our client is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

Responsibilities:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent experience is required plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus 6 years of relevant experience.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is preferred at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Qualifications:
Put your engineering talent to the ultimate test. At our client, we create the technologies, products and services that help our service members, intelligence analysts and first responders keep our nation safe. The work we do is so advanced our teams often redefine what’s possible for the world. If you want to be a leader with the company that delivers smart solutions for our nation’s challenges, this is your opportunity.

We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.

As a seasoned leader, you’ll be involved with our client's decision-making process by serving as a front-line interface to users with technical issues and conducting systems analysis and development to keep systems current with changing technologies. Your duties may include installing new software, troubleshooting, granting permissions to applications and training users. You’ll also be responsible for the day-to-day support of server services by performing server administration for physical and virtual server operating systems and configuring, maintaining and troubleshooting of physical and virtual hardware and network related interfaces on servers. We’ll rely on you to perform, maintain, troubleshoot and conduct a complete analysis of alerts; create scripts to automate repetitive processes; and work with customers to identify, isolate, and resolve problems with servers that are affecting other services.

What you’ll experience:

Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered

What you bring to the table:

A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent experience plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus 6 years of relevant experience
Advanced understanding of server based operating systems
Linux including RHEL/CentOS, specifically secure environments. Virtualized and bare metal.
Microsoft Windows 10 desktop and Microsoft Windows 2008/2012
Infrastructure aspects of Linux related to authentication, policy, scanning, logging, storage.
Networking. Mainly Cisco, Taclanes, WANs,
Subject matter expert (SME) with the ability to mentor others on administrating the server environment
Enhanced troubleshooting skills within the server OS as well as both networking and storage technologies
Hands-on experience developing, deploying and supporting large-scale enterprise server solutions

What sets you apart:

Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Broad understanding of the interrelationships within the IT environment with focus on server and services
Senior level knowledge of physical and virtual server support
Senior level knowledge of access, permissions and security that gives the clients the access to the data they need to perform their daily activities

job_description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of technical leadership and people management experience.
Experience managing software development projects.

Preferred qualifications:

Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering.
Experience working with industry partners in the enterprise space.
Experience with integrating third-party tools and services.
Knowledge of the production environment, software development methodology and tool structures.
About the job
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started - and as a manager, you guide the way.

Want to help build the most innovative solutions to scale our Google Fiber business? As a Software Engineering Manager, you will build systems to optimize the results throughout the lifecycle of network and customers. You will work with other engineering and business teams to build and integrate as needed. You will lead a team and execute well in a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous environment and utilize your passion to apply and invent technologies to enable scaling and faster pace of execution for the business.
The Google Access team works to make Internet access more powerful, accessible and affordable for all. We also work to develop the next-generation technologies that will improve the lives and businesses of our millions of users around the planet. Want to change the world? Good. So do we
Responsibilities
Lead a team of software engineers and vendor developers that design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve the software built on top of both Google and external tech stacks.
Drive all technical aspects of the development, including technical requirements definition, design, implementation, unit testing and integration. Oversee detailed designs, implementation and test plan reviews to ensure high quality results.
Collaborate closely with product management, program management, and cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and expectations.
Attract, grow, and retain talent, providing technical direction and career growth opportunities and creating an inclusive, diverse culture.

job_description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
The future is what you make it!
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.
Are you ready to help us make the future?
Lead Enterprise Automation strategy and assure effective delivery of sustained technology development for Automation across Honeywell. You will be the primary interface to business and domain leaders to define automation roadmap, requirements and drive development execution enabled through existing and emerging tools. You will be a key member of the IT Application Quote to Cash leadership team, engaging in all aspects of running the IT, with a specialization in the use of technology to fulfill business objectives. You will provide leadership in improving IT process and developing IT team capabilities.
Key Responsibilities:
 Develop IT strategy and vision around technology and development
 Provide Automation Architecture and Development Services
 Deliver Automation and Cognitive Services in areas of Process, BOTs, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
 Drive new ideas beyond traditional automation mindset and work across team to get them executed, like OCR, Integration, EDI, etc.
 Align with overall Architecture and Standards Services
 Educate business on technology around automation
 Manage IT professionals
YOU MUST HAVE:
 Bachelor's degree
WE VALUE:
 Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field
 Leadership experience in two or more Information Technology, Engineering or Business functional areas
 Excellent leadership communication and executive presence
 Understanding of key information technology solutions and practices
 Strong business acumen and ability to translate new technology into business value
 Creation of result-oriented Management Operating System
 Effectively demonstrates ability to deliver on complex situations or problems
 Creative and collaborative problem-solving capability
 Conveys specific, observable, and measurable expectations for each assignment
 Driving "fast and right" results in a matrixed environment
 Consistently makes timely decisions even in the face of complexity
Additional Information
JOB ID: HRD96023
Category: Information Technology
Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States
Exempt
Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

job_description:
We are looking for a senior product manager to define and own the product vision and roadmap for our Analyse, Secure and Transport products within the United Kingdom (UK). Products that extract insights, protect and dynamically share our critical customer data. As a senior product manager at Rebellion, you will be responsible for a key part of a rapidly growing portfolio of products, working to rally Rebellion design and engineering teams to deliver on the vision you’ve charted. You will work with Rebellion’s customers and prospective customers, senior UK Ministry of Defence (MOD) civilian and military leadership, the UK Intelligence Community and the United States (US) Department of Defence (DoD) to understand the core customer needs and to bring a product to market.

This position is located in London, and involves some travel within the UK and internationally. An ability to hold a UK national security clearance is preferred, but not required.
We are looking for a track record that will include the following:
Delivering software-as-a-service products that scale to large enterprises or consumer bases,
Working with software engineers with diverse expertise to deliver a superior product to an end userBalancing customer needs with engineering constraints,
Thorough understanding of product management, engineering, design, and sales functions of the businessDefining and exceeding success metrics with the products you buildInspirational leadership — the ability to coalesce many groups of stakeholders around a common goal without direct authority,
Working with users and shipping products in highly regulated industries or otherwise constrained environments (e.g., government, healthcare, national security, industrial systems design),
Managing senior customer stakeholders with decades of experience in their field,
Communicating effectively across diverse technical and non-technical audiences, internally and externally,
Establishing clear product-market fit, understanding the core customer need, and breaking this into priorities for design and engineering teamsExperience bringing artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision products to market (preferred),
At least 8 years of experience in product management or product design.
You might be a good fit if you:
Have a passion for getting to know the user and protecting the UK, the US and its allies from adversaries,
Are self-directed and can prioritise experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer,
Are capable of rapid iteration and comfortable with ambiguity in initial problem definition.
As the senior product manager in the UK, your work will drive our strategic product and technology vision across each of our product areas. You will own the team's products, existing or new, from ideation through development to launch, growth, and expansion.

Rebellion is a well-capitalized technology start-up seeking a talented senior product manager who is passionate about defining and delivering modern, life-changing software products to the US Department of Defense (DoD), the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), and their allies. At Rebellion we believe in operating what we own, we deliver all of our products as managed services, this allows our product teams to maintain operational ownership across all deployments. Expect talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers. Compensation includes meaningful equity ownership, competitive salaries, full medical coverage, disability and life insurance, and transit reimbursement.
job_description_requirements: Managing senior customer stakeholders with decades of experience in their field,.  Experience bringing artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision products to market (preferred),.  At least 8 years of experience in product management or product design.  Are self-directed and can prioritise experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer,

job_description:
Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree in systems engineering, a related specialized area or field is required (or equivalent experience) plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience. Agile experience preferred.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.
Responsibilities for this Position:
Developing mission-critical systems that help keep people safe is what we do. At General Dynamics Mission Systems, you’ll be part of the team that helps heroes make a true impact. The work we do is important. The challenges we face are career-defining. The opportunity we can offer is one-of-a-kind.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar space and everything in between.

As a X-Lab Systems Engineer/Analyst Lead, you’ll lead model and simulation activities as you participate in requirements analysis and management, functional analysis, performance analysis, system design, trade studies, systems integration and test (verification). It’s your chance to step up to the challenge and prove you’re ready to lead the world.
The Command and Control, Battle Management, and Communications Experimentation Laboratory (C2BMC X-Lab) is a very fast paced and dynamic environment. The X-Lab is responsible for developing and integrating future-capability prototypes for the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS) including Sensor/Weapon Integration, Algorithm Development, User Interface Development and other critical leading-edge missile defense technologies. The X-Lab has a need to augment the team with a senior systems engineer and analysis lead that holds at least a Secret clearance with a TS/SCI being preferable and possesses demonstrable skills in the following areas:

Analysis tool development using MATLAB, Excel, S-Code, Satellite Toolkit (STK), etc.
Perform verification and validation of systems (functional and performance)
Full cycle systems engineering of new capabilities
System and subsystem decomposition
Use case, system requirements, performance specification development, and UML modeling
System interface design & Interface Control Document development
Conducting and participating in peer reviews
Good communication skills (written and oral)
Leadership of a team composed of multiple disciplines
This position will focus on and lead the analysis of R&D systems in C2BMC and will contribute to other ongoing X-Lab projects as needed. Including the assessment on how the C2BMC prototype system performs by identifying high level objectives and refining into an integrated set of metrics, analysis tool development, assessment of experimental data, generating and presenting customer-quality products containing analytical observations. The Lead Analyst will apply these results to identify and work to enhance C2BMC for future operations. The Lead Analyst must possess expertise in a technical discipline related to systems engineering, analysis, or missile defense. The Lead Analyst should be comfortable with rapidly changing requirements, design challenges that require novel solutions, fast-paced activities, and tight deadlines.

The Lead Analyst must have [12+] years of experience leading or contributing to an integrated team environment with other systems, software, and specialty engineers to develop solutions that includes a background in all aspects of the analysis life cycle. The Lead Analyst should have experience with identification of analysis objectives, metric generation, data assessment, and presentation of the results. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to analyze high level customer needs and defined a structured and logical approach to refine the objectives and analysis requirements. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to communicate effectively, developed and scripted analysis tools, clearly present technical approaches and findings, and have experience in writing and implementing analysis plans within a project. Ideally, the Lead Analyst will have experience in working on IRAD-type projects.

Position Responsibilities:
Perform as individual contributor and Analyst Lead for advanced concepts development projects. This includes directing the activities of junior level engineers. Contribute in full lifecycle development of advanced concepts. Position is responsible for performing the evaluation of advanced missile defense command and control capabilities to provide highly innovative and ingenious solutions to complex technical problems. Including defining and
coordinating analysis objectives and metrics for various experimental prototypes, performing the associated analysis, and serve as the X-Lab spokesperson on advanced projects when briefing results to the customer. Actions are critical to achieving X-Lab organizational objectives and directly affect the impact of X-Lab technological capability. Assignments are often self-initiated with consultation and agreement of X-Lab leadership. The Lead Analyst will provide oversight of maintenance and improvements to the analysis tool suite. Support advanced concept demonstrations during live and simulated MDA test events. Non-standard work hours are highly likely during event execution and a small amount of travel may be required.

Preferred Qualifications:
The primary work location is the Missile Defense Integration and Operations Center (MDIOC) located on Schriever AFB, CO. The following knowledge base and/or skills are desired for the Senior Systems Engineer:
Integration practices and methodsTest driven development and continuous integration
Ability to extract data to support analysis
Operating systems experience with Windows & Unix/Linux
Algorithm design and implementation
DoD Architecture Framework (DoDAF)
Physics & mechanics of powered and ballistic missile flightTheory and application of the BMDS
Theory and application of command and control systems
Theory and application of track correlation algorithms
Probability theory and optimal state estimation
Familiarity with Link-16, including content, transmission rules, etcCoding skills a plus (Java, C++, and shell scripts)
Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

Agile experience preferred.  The X-Lab has a need to augment the team with a senior systems engineer and analysis lead that holds at least a Secret clearance with a TS/SCI being preferable and possesses demonstrable skills in the following areas:. job_title: Sr. Principal AI Software Development Engineer
정리된 job_title: Sr. Principal AI Software Development Engineer
job_description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems in air and space that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our work preserves freedom and democracy, and advances human discovery and our understanding of the universe. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have a lot of fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems has an opening for a Sr. Principal Artificial Intelligence Software Development Engineer to join our team of highly qualified and diverse individuals. This position will be located in Redondo Beach, California and will perform research into and development of artificial intelligence and/or machine learning software to support aircraft programs and advanced technologies.


Essential Functions:
Design, develop, implement, and evaluate artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms for scene understanding and course of action generation.
Advance the state of the art of AI by developing and demonstrating new technologies in relevant operational environment
Develop human-centered AI systems to augment human decision making to increase the quality of decisions
Interact with customers to build relationships, pursue, and capture funding opportunities in AI
NGLinkedAS

Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics) discipline from an accredited university and 9 years of STEM related engineering experience, or a Master's Degree in a STEM discipline and 7 years of experience, or 4 years of experience with a PhD.
Proven experience conducting research in and developing artificial intelligence (AI) and/or machine learning (ML) software (demonstrated by Kaggle, competitions, open source contributions, academic papers, etc)
Proficiency with AI programming languages and tools (e.g., ProgR, Python, TensorFlow, SQL, OWL)
Candidates must have, and be able to maintain, a current active in-scope U.S. Government DoD Secret security clearance or higher which is required to start, with the ability to obtain Special Program Access (SAP).
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience using DevOps Tools like Docker/Kubernetes
Portfolio of algorithms/code demonstrating application of AI to real-world problems (e.g., GitHub, Kaggle, academic papers, competitions)
Working knowledge of robotics
Familiarity with state of art data cleansing, model training and generation using one or more of the following: RF, IR, hyperspectral sensor modalities
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to deploy machine learning algorithms to prototype testing and production
A current active in-scope U.S. Government DoD Top Secret Clearance with experience working on Special Access Programs
Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions..
